part.narration:
Announcement! And now, representing Sega and its newest development studio, The New Parisian-Nagoyan Network, Vice President Yuki Soleil-Takeshi!
Yuki takes a while to get up. Ms. Takeshi? Are you around?
Yuki leaves her seat. She finagles her way thorugh the seating arrangement. Hands slam hands. The applause echoes. And echoes. And echoes. She looks ahead. The stage-steps end abruptly, afterward an abyss. The wind howls. Come on Yuki, get up there — Yuki runs down the aisle and to the stage-steps. Ramp up sound, ramp up heartbeat.She leaps. Yuki stands on air. The crowd goes silent. She turns to them. All stare ahead towards the blank screen and the blank woman, readied for first impression.Cut to far-away view encompassing Yuki and crowd.Yuki clears her throat. Games! Yuki raises hands to the heavens, projecting personality without an amplifier. The presentation starts. The screen shows Sega's logo.Cut to close up of Yuki's face. Player doesn't get to see what's on that screen otherwise.Yuki turns to look. Yuki gasps. The crowd shivers. Hardened journalists salute. Softened ones go into shock. Designers pray. Producers stare. Raymond sheds a tear. Yuki whispers. Oh my god. Silence. Yuki, soft a-puff and hard a-pant, turns weak-legged to the crowd. That's — that's the game. Yuki exits, everyone staring at her walk.Player has to walk Yuki out, camera does not follow. Sudden cut. Flash. Fantastic presentation! Not a single buzzword! You actually have stage presence! Let me take a picture with you! Hey, pose with us! With every flash, the framerate lowers.Time fades. Yuki loses track of the number of pictures.
